channel.title: Httrack and Whonix
channel.description:
I am interested in using httrack and Whonix but I want to make sure I don't ruin security in unexpected ways, especically in regards to stream isolation since I have used httrack and TBB at the same time in the past.
https://packages.debian.org/wheezy/httrack
One issue is that httrack doesn''t natively support SOCKS so when I ran httrack under Windows I would use the following set-up.
httrack----Privoxy---Tor---Internet
with Privoxy necessary to forward HTTP to SOCKS5t
So what is the best way to replicate this concept under Whonix without mucking things up?

item.title: Httrack and Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix

Stream Isolation

Prevent Identity Correlation through Circuit Sharing by using Tor Stream Isolation

Read full topic

item.title: Httrack and Whonix
item.dc:creator: jimmy
item.description:
I am interested in using httrack and Whonix but I want to make sure I don’t ruin security in unexpected ways, especically in regards to stream isolation since I have used httrack and TBB at the same time in the past.

https://packages.debian.org/wheezy/httrack

One issue is that httrack doesn’'t natively support SOCKS so when I ran httrack under Windows I would use the following set-up.

httrack----Privoxy—Tor—Internet

with Privoxy necessary to forward HTTP to SOCKS5t

So what is the best way to replicate this concept under Whonix without mucking things up?
